Issues.Title: refactor(core): update migrations descriptions
Issues.Body:
With the next version of the CLI we don't need to add logging for the description of the schematic as part of the schematic itself.

This is because now, the CLI will print the description defined in the `migrations.json` file.

See: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/15951
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(core): update migrations descriptions" (#33440)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): `ViewRef.rootNodes` returns rootNodes from child views as well
Issues.Body:
The idea behind `rootNodes` is to return all of the nodes which need
to be added to the DOM in order for the `ViewRef` to be rendered.
The new implementation correctly takes into account the case where
one of the rootNodes is a container containing other `ViewRef`s.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): `ViewRef.rootNodes` returns rootNodes from child views as well" (#33457)

Issues.Title: feat(ivy): graceful evaluation of unknown or invalid expressions
Issues.Body:
During static evaluation of expressions within ngtsc, it may occur that
certain expressions or just parts thereof cannot be statically
interpreted for some reason. The static interpreter keeps track of the
failure reason and the code path that was evaluated by means of
`DynamicValue`, which will allow descriptive errors. In some situations
however, the static interpreter would throw an exception instead,
resulting in a crash of the compilation. Not only does this cause
non-descriptive errors, more importantly does it prevent the evaluated
result from being partial, i.e. parts of the result can be dynamic if
their value does not have to be statically available to the compiler.

This commit refactors the static interpreter to never throw errors for
certain expressions that it cannot evaluate.

Resolves FW-1582
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(ivy): graceful evaluation of unknown or invalid expressions" (#33453)

# üêû bug report

### Affected Package

@angular/bazel

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Type checking performed by ngtsc is currently matching as much as possible with what NGC did. Since ngtsc type checking can be more advanced, there are flags to enable more advanced checking of templates. 

These flags cannot be set from within the `ng_module` Bazel rule unfortunately. The issue is that `ngc-wrapped` does not redirect the new strictness flags. It will be cumbersome to redirect all individual strictness flags, so we need to think about the ideal API for these type checking flags
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bazel: unable to enable ngtsc strict template type checking" (#33452)

Issues.Title: Input coercion static members cannot be used with NGC and strictMetadataEmit enabled
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üêû bug report

### Affected Package

@angular/compiler-cli

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Switching between ngtsc and ngc is not possible when coercion static members are declared for components. e.g.

```ts
class MyComp {
  ...

  static ngAcceptInputType_disabled: boolean | string;
}
```

This works as expected in ngtsc, but as soon as the project is compiled with `ngc`, the metadata validator throws an exception:


```
Error encountered in metadata generated for exported symbol 'MyComp': 
 /home/circleci/ng/src/cdk/my-comp.ts:422:10: 

Metadata collected contains an error that will be reported at runtime: Only initialized variables and constants can be referenced because the value of this variable is needed by the template compiler.
  {"__symbolic":"error","message":"Variable not initialized","line":421,"character":9}
```

The error for the static members is actually valid since it only happens if `strictMetadataEmit` is enabled.. and this means that NGC validates that there is no unresolved symbol in the source file metadata. Though, since libraries want to keep that flag enabled to ensure that the metadata works in all cases, we need a way to skip accept coercion members for Ivy/ViewEngine compatibility.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Input coercion static members cannot be used with NGC and strictMetadataEmit enabled" (#33451)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler): i18n - ignore `alt-trans` tags in XLIFF 1.2
Issues.Body:
The parser was accidentally reading the `target` tag
below the `alt-trans` target and overriding the correct
`target` tag.

(This already worked in `$localize` but a test has been
added to confirm.)

Fixes #33161

---

This needs to be merged to patch as well, but I don't think will go cleanly because of the `$localize` test.
So I will create a new PR for patch once this has been approved.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler): i18n - ignore `alt-trans` tags in XLIFF 1.2" (#33450)

Issues.Title: test(ivy): Have more descriptive names for `LView`
Issues.Body:
When debugging `LView`s it is easy to get lost since all of them have
the same name. This change does three things:

1. It makes `TView` have an explicit type:
  - `Host`: for the top level `TView` for bootstrap
  - `Component`: for the `TView` which represents components template
  - `Embedded`: for the `TView` which represents an embedded template
2. It changes the name of `LView` to `LHostView`, `LComponentView`, and
  `LEmbeddedView` depending on the `TView` type.
3. For `LComponentView` and `LEmbeddedView` we also append the name of
  of the `context` constructor. The result is that we have `LView`s which
  are name as: `LComponentView_MyComponent` and `LEmbeddedView_NgIfContext`.

The above changes will make it easier to understand the structure of the
application when debugging.

NOTE: All of these are behind `ngDevMode` and will get removed in
production application.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "test(ivy): Have more descriptive names for `LView`" (#33449)

Issues.Title: Attribute Selector changes Input behaviour
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package `@angular/core` ### Is this a regression? No ### Description As of #18156 a combination of an element selector and an attribute selector can be used to define required inputs, e.g. `selector: 'my-component[myRequiredInput]'`. This works correctly under normal circumstances. However unit tests reset the input value when triggering a change detection (`fixture.detectChanges`). This does not occur if the attribute selector is removed, e.g. for `selector: 'my-component'`. These errors are also reported by users in #18156. This behaviour can be seen in the unit tests of the sample repo. There is a second issue which is very likely related to this. Again if a component has a selector combined of element and attribute and it is used as a component in the router, any previously set value will be overriden. Note that using a component with inputs as a routable component might not be something angular is expected to do correctly. This issue is also demonstrated in the sample repo and in [https://angular-issue-repro2-vtyahq.stackblitz.io/](this stackblitz). ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction [https://github.com/marcuskrahl/attribute-selector-angular](repo) [https://angular-issue-repro2-vtyahq.stackblitz.io/](stackblitz) ## üî• Exception or Error It should not matter whether if a selector is defined including an attribute selector or not. The behaviour for routing and unit tests should stay the same ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: BUILD ERROR 'Note' is not exported by node_modules/**
Issues.Body:
Hi.

From an angular project, when referencing to a model which is defiend on a Typescript module and as well it is exported as follows:
> export * from './base/models';

angular compiler complains when building, that the module is not exporting the model called "Note".

The following export works ok.
> export { Note } from './base/models/note.model';

But, I am more interested on the first export mode using the wild card.

Thank you.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "BUILD ERROR 'Note' is not exported by node_modules/**" (#33442)

Issues.Title: Error in application build in prod mode
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core@8.2.9 ### Is this a regression? ### Description Devextreme-angular prepared the package with angular package format and now the package is created using ng-packagr package (You can see the package structure [here](https://github.com/ovchinnikov/devextreme-angular-build)). We found an issue with building the application when using short paths to the module, like this: > import { DxButtonModule } from 'devextreme-angular'; We get an error: > ERROR in Unexpected value 'DxButtonModule in C:/Users/Documents/Github/ngExample/node_modules/devextreme-angular/devextreme-angular.d.ts' imported by the module 'AppModule in C:/Users/Documents/Github/ngExample/src/app/app.module.ts'. Please add a @NgModule annotation. When using long paths, like this > import { DxButtonModule } from 'devextreme-angular/ui/button'; , there is no error Also, if you use a build with dev mode, there will be no error ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction You can reproduce it using the [repo](https://github.com/dxvladislavvolkov/ngExample) Following the steps: 1. npm i 2. ng build --prod and then you get the error ## üî• Exception or Error 



ERROR in Unexpected value 'DxButtonModule in C:/Users/volkov.vladislav/Documents/Work/Github/ex/ngExample/node_modules/devextreme-angular/devextreme-angular.d.ts' imported by the module 'AppModule in C:/Users/volkov.vladislav/Documents/Work/Github/ex/ngExample/src/app/app.module.ts'. Please add a @NgModule annotation.
'dx-button' is not a known element:
1. If 'dx-button' is an Angular component, then verify that it is part of this module.
2. If 'dx-button' is a Web Component then add 'CUSTOM_ELEMENTS_SCHEMA' to the '@NgModule.schemas' of this component to suppress this message. ("[ERROR ->]")

Issues.Title: --stats-json generates broken output
Issues.Body:
This issue probably caused because if ivy enabled ### Is this a regression? Yes, when ivy was not enabled feature was working correctly ### Description 1. before ivy there was 2 stats.json files present: `stats-es5.json` and `stats-es2015.json` Now only `stats-es2015.json` geneated 2. In newly created `stats-es2015.json` there is a link to broken polyfill bunlde file, like: `polyfills-es5-es2015.hash.js` there are two different files produced during the build: `polyfills-es5.hash.js` and `polyfills-es2015.hash.js` but `stats-es2015.json` refers to nonexistant file ## Minimal Reproduction Create new project with ivy enabled, run `ng build --prod --stats-json` inspect produced bundle - es5 report is missing try to run `webpack-bundle-analyzer stats-es2015.json --mode static --report webpack.html` it will fail becouse of refference to missing file. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: docs(docs-infra): fix (notation of) microsyntax grammar
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### What's the affected URL? https://angular.io/guide/structural-directives#grammar ### Description The current grammar is defined by the following production rules: *:prefix="( :let | :expression ) (';' | ',')? ( :let | :as | :keyExp )*" keyExp = :key ":"? :expression ("as" :local)? ";"? let = "let" :local "=" :export ";"? as = :export "as" :local ";"? I describe several issues of the used notation and grammar rules. Each issue and my suggested solution is described in a section. The sections are separated by a horizontal line in the following. The presented solutions build on the (changes of the) previous solutions. The last section shows the final result (production rules). --- **Issue:** Production rule `*:prefix` is not formatted consistently. **Solution:** Use one space character before and after `=`. Use one space character before `(` and no space character after `(`. Use no space character before `)`. Use one space character after `)` if it is not followed by an operator (`?` or `*`). Otherwise, only write one space character after the operator, but only if the operator is not followed by `)`. *:prefix = " (:let | :expression) (';' | ',')? (:let | :as | :keyExp)* " --- **Issue:** Prefix `:` of nonterminal symbols creates no added value. **Solution:** Remove `:` *prefix = " (let | expression) (';' | ',')? (let | as | keyExp)* " keyExp = key ":"? expression ("as" local)? ";"? let = "let" local "=" export ";"? as = export "as" local ";"? --- **Issue:** No consistent use of double quotation marks `"` in the production rules. `"` is used as terminal symbol in production rule `*prefix`, but as delimiter of string literals (sequence of terminal symbols) in the other production rules `keyExp`, `let` and `as`. **Solution:** Use `'` as delimiter and surround the double quotation terminal symbol with delimiters: *prefix = '"' (let | expression) (';' | ',')? (let | as | keyExp)* '"' keyExp = key ':'? expression ('as' local)? ';'? let = 'let' local '=' export ';'? as = export 'as' local ';'? --- **Issue:** Assignment of `export` to `local` variable is mandatory in production rule `let`, but the implementation allows to omit explicit assignment, like `let x` in

{{x}}

which is treated like an implicit assignment of the special context property `$implicit` to `x`. **Solution:** Make assignment optional in production rule `let`: let = 'let' local ('=' export)? ';'? --- **Issue:** The current grammar definition allows the production of two consecutive semicolons, see derivation example: *prefix = '"' (let | expression) (';' | ',')? (let | as | keyExp)* '"' = '"' (let ) ';' (let | as | keyExp)* '"' = '"' ('let' local ('=' export)? ';'?) ';' (let | as | keyExp)* '"' = '"' 'let' local '=' export ';' ';' (let | as | keyExp)* '"' But the current implementation throws `Template parse errors` in that case, for example:

{{i}}: {{x}}

**Solution:** Extract semicolon production from rule `let` into rule `*prefix` and move separator production `(';' | ',')?` to the alternative `expression`: *prefix = '"' (let ';'? | expression (';' | ',')?) (let ';'? | as | keyExp)* '"' keyExp = key ':'? expression ('as' local)? ';'? let = 'let' local ('=' export)? as = export 'as' local ';'? --- **Issue:** Production rules do not consider that (terminal symbol) colon may be used instead of semicolon separator. For example

{{i}}: {{item}}

can not be produced using the current rules due to the colon after `myTrack`, but it is valid syntax in the implementation. **Solution:** Define production rule `sep` (abbreviation of *separator*): *prefix = '"' (let sep? | expression sep?) (let sep? | as | keyExp)* '"' sep = ';' | ',' keyExp = key ':'? expression ('as' local)? sep? let = 'let' local ('=' export)? as = export 'as' local sep? This can be simplified by moving `sep?` around in the definitions *prefix = '"' (let | expression) sep? ((let | as | keyExp) sep?)* '"' sep = ';' | ',' keyExp = key ':'? expression ('as' local)? let = 'let' local ('=' export)? as = export 'as' local This code block represents my **final suggestion**.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs(docs-infra): fix (notation of) microsyntax grammar" (#33436)

Issues.Title: feat(bazel): update bazel-schematics to use Ivy and new rollup_bundle
Issues.Body:
Note: the @angular/bazel schematic now prepends the package.json "script" field with `ngcc; ` if there is an existing script field. ViewEngine sources under node_modules need to be updated in-place for Bazel as it does not know how to use the `__ivy__` entry points that are created by the non-bazel `ngcc` command that is added to "scripts" :`ngcc --properties es2015 browser module main --first-only --create-ivy-entry-points`.


## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [x] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

@angular/bazel schematics was depending on the legacy rollup_bundle rule which will be removed for the nodejs rules 1.0 release and it was building ViewEngine


## What is the new behavior?

@angular/bazel schematics updated to Ivy & to the new rollup_bundle rule

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [ ] No

Issues.Title: perf(ivy): avoid generating selectors array for directives without a selector
Issues.Body: Now that we've replaced `ngBaseDef` with an abstract directive definition, there are a lot more cases where we generate a directive definition without a selector. These changes make it so that we don't generate the `selectors` array if it's going to be empty.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(ivy): avoid generating selectors array for directives without a selector" (#33431)

Issues.Title: build: bump maximum allowed yarn version
Issues.Body: Currently this repo allows Yarn between 1.17.3 and 1.18.0, whereas the components repo requires a minimum of 1.19.1 which makes it annoying to switch between repositories. These changes bump the maximum allowed Yarn version.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: bump maximum allowed yarn version" (#33430)

Issues.Title: Decorator of AsyncValidator example should be a Directive not an Injectable
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->

# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

The Decorator shouldn't be an Injectable as in the example.

It should be a Directive:
`@Directive({
  selector: '[uniqueAlterEgoValidator]',
  providers: [{
      provide: NG_ASYNC_VALIDATORS,
      useExisting: UniqueAlterEgoValidatorDirective,
      multi: true
    }
  ]
})`

I want to point out, that you need to provide NG_ASYNC_VALIDATORS instead of NG_VALIDATORS, which wasn't documented in the guide.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

### What's the affected URL?**
https://angular.io/guide/form-validation#implementing-custom-async-validator
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Decorator of AsyncValidator example should be a Directive not an Injectable" (#33429)

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>zloirock/core-js</summary>

### [`v3.3.5`](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​335---20191029)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/compare/v3.3.4...v3.3.5)

-   Added a workaround of V8 deoptimization which causes serious performance degradation (~4x in my tests) of `Array#concat`, [#​679](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/679)
-   Added a workaround of V8 deoptimization which causes slightly performance degradation of `Promise`, [#​679](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/679)
-   Added `(Async)Iterator.prototype.constructor -> (Async)Iterator` per [this issue](https://togithub.com/tc39/proposal-iterator-helpers/issues/60)
-   Added compat data for Chromium-based Edge

</details>

Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [x] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [x] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...

Currently the CLI creates `browserslist` file by `ng new`. 
The file name `browserslist` is a kind of deprecation. Previously, the new file name `.browserslistrc` was introduced.

https://github.com/browserslist/browserslist/commit/7231ccd3a0e083871538fb6245f28afd6e7b92cd

They said `browserslist` is conflicting with the npx package name.

And in Angular.io, `.browserslistrc` is only mentioned. 

https://angular.io/guide/build#configuring-browser-compatibility


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.

Generate the same file as `.browserslistrc` on `ng new` or `ng generate application`.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?

Browserslist still is supporing old config file name for backward-compatibility. So workaround is not needed.

-   Fixed work of `fetch` with polyfilled `URLSearchParams`, [#​674](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/674)

-   Added compat data for Chrome 80

Issues.Title: Several fixes for Universal/Server
Issues.Body:
fix(@schematics/angular): universal add outputHashing to media
In case the browser builder hashes the assets we need to add this setting to the server builder as otherwise when assets it will be requested twice. One for the server which will be unhashed, and other on the client which will be hashed.

Closes #15953


fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): don't emit CSS resources during a server build

The server should serve the assets emitted by the browser builder. In fact the nguniversal schematics are configured to serve the assets from the browser folder
https://github.com/angular/universal/blob/a0cc9ab97a70370eff872664ac46391a193aa45e/modules/express-engine/schematics/install/files/__serverFileName%40stripTsExtension__.ts#L26

Closes #12878

Issues.Title: Outdated buffer sub dependency causes `global is not defined` error
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report Following #8160 I found that it is still possible to cause the `global ist not defined` error without installing a library that actively uses `global`. It is caused by `buffer` which is a sub dependency of `@angular-devkit/build-angular`. ### Command (mark with an `x`) No command. It is a runtime issue. Any command that builds the project obviously. ### Is this a regression? Yes, the regression is obviously the removal of the `global` shim. ### Description `@angular-devkit/build-angular` depends on a version of webpack, which depends on a version of node-libs-browser (deprecated!) which depends on a version of buffer that is actually using `global`. ``` $ npm ls buffer iotgen-webui@0.1.0 /Users/ohcibi/Documents/Projekte/PERK/iotgen/iotgen-webui ‚îî‚îÄ‚î¨@angular-devkit/build-angular@0.803.14 ‚îî‚îÄ‚î¨ webpack@4.39.2 ‚îî‚îÄ‚î¨ node-libs-browser@2.2.1 ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ buffer@4.9.1 ``` The latest versions of the `buffer` package have fixed that but since `node-libs-browser` is deprecated, this won't fix on webpack4. webpack 5 does not have the node-libs-browser dependency anymore. The library I have installed and try to import was `jwt-simple`. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ``` npm install -D jwt-simple # Add `import jwt from 'jwt-simple' to some angular module ng serve # Visit route that uses the module with the import and see error in console ``` ## üî• Exception or Error 

index.js:43 Uncaught ReferenceError: global is not defined
    at Object../node_modules/buffer/index.js (index.js:43)
    at __webpack_require__ (bootstrap:79)
    at Object../node_modules/safe-buffer/index.js (index.js:2)
    at __webpack_require__ (bootstrap:79)
    at Object../node_modules/randombytes/browser.js (browser.js:15)
    at __webpack_require__ (bootstrap:79)
    at Object../node_modules/crypto-browserify/index.js (index.js:3)
    at __webpack_require__ (bootstrap:79)
    at Object../node_modules/jwt-simple/lib/jwt.js (jwt.js:13)
    at __webpack_require__ (bootstrap:79)
## üåç Your Environment

   / ‚Äö√±‚â• \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|

Issues.Title: Each build of an Angular library is missing random files in the output folder
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? First time creating library myself, but I have never seen this bug in other libraries. ### Description Each run of my library (ng build hal-components) (my library) is missing random files in the dist/hal-components/lib folder. A few runs gives me all files, but most (ca 90%) is missing several files. The files missing changes on each run. Restarting the computer temporarily solves the problem, but it returns after a few hours to one days of use without a restart Still get the bug if I stop the ng serve command on the consuming project. I get the bug both with, and without the watch flag. This bug is really annoying as I need to manually check if all files are present before publishing to NPM. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Library is still tiny so I can link to it: https://github.com/hafslundnett/hal-components/tree/build-bug Only getting the bug on Windows (also tested on Mac, but did not get the bug). Bug is periodic, but what I do is: 1. `yarn` 2. `ng build hal-components` 3. Check the `dist/hal-components/lib` for missing components from the library ## üî• Exception or Error There is no error, just random missing files. ## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 8.3.12
Node: 10.16.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 8.1.3
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.801.3
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.801.3
@angular-devkit/build-ng-packagr   0.801.3
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer    0.801.3
@angular-devkit/build-webpack      0.801.3
@angular-devkit/core               8.3.12
@angular-devkit/schematics         8.3.12
@angular/cdk                       8.2.3
@angular/cli                       8.3.12
@angular/material                  8.2.3
@ngtools/webpack                   8.1.3
@schematics/angular                8.3.12
@schematics/update                 0.803.12
ng-packagr                         5.7.0
rxjs                               6.4.0
typescript                         3.4.5
webpack                            4.35.2
**Anything else relevant?** Running the latest version of Windows 10 Enterprise. I understand this will be hard to solve, so I appreciate any workaround as a solution if anyone has a suggestion.

Issues.Title: ng update fails on latest angular cli
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [x] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? N/A ### Description ng update --all fails on a new project ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. install latest angular cli `yarn global add @angular/cli ` 2. create a new project `ng new projectname` 3. cd into project 4. run `ng update --all` 5. observe We shouldn't have any incompatible peer dependencies. We have two: 1. Package "@angular/core" has an incompatible peer dependency to "zone.js" (requires "~0.9.1", would install "0.10.2"). 2. Package "@angular/compiler-cli" has an incompatible peer dependency to "typescript" (requires ">=3.4 <3.6", would install "3.6.4"). ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): only ngcc in prepare
Issues.Body: This fix is to make is so an npm/yarn install with --production mode will not fail as ngcc won't have been installed yet. This allows for workflows with docker and other production build mechanics.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): only ngcc in prepare" (#15939)

Issues.Title: test: fix webdriver errors
Issues.Body: 'yarn' will nuke the entire node_modules when it is triggered during the above tests. Let's restore the previous node_modules state by re-installing using 'npm' and run 'webdriver-update'.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "test: fix webdriver errors" (#15934)

Issues.Title: build: update puppeteer to version 2.0.0
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [puppeteer](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer) | dependencies | major | [`1.12.2` -> `2.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/puppeteer/1.12.2/2.0.0) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>GoogleChrome/puppeteer</summary>

### [`v2.0.0`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/releases/v2.0.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/compare/v1.20.0...v2.0.0)

#### Big changes

-   Chromium 79.0.3942.0 (r705776)
-   Puppeteer now requires Node.js v8+; Node.js v6 is no longer supported
-   `page.screenshot` now clips elements to the viewport ([#​5080](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5080))
-   New APIs:
    -   [`page.emulateTimezone(timezoneId)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatetimezonetimezoneid)
    -   [`page.emulateMediaType(type)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatypetype) (superseding the old [`page.emulateMedia(type)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatype) API)
    -   [`page.emulateMediaFeatures(features)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatypetype)

#### API changes

-   New API: [`page.emulateTimezone(timezoneId)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatetimezonetimezoneid) ([#​4949](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/4949))
-   New API: [`page.emulateMediaType(type)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatypetype) ([#​5012](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5012))
-   Deprecated API: [`page.emulateMedia(type)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatype) is now obsolete. Use [`page.emulateMediaType(type)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatypetype) instead. ([#​5012](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5012))
-   New API: [`page.emulateMediaFeatures(features)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatypetype) ([#​5012](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5012))

#### Raw notes

[`aa24697`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/aa24697) - chore: mark version v2.0.0 ([#​5078](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5078))
[`360c1b4`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/360c1b4) - test: add page.screenshot viewport clipping test ([#​5079](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5079))
[`7f3e372`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/7f3e372) - docs(api): improve page.waitFor docs for the `options` object ([#​5021](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5021))
[`8132b39`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/8132b39) - test: remove duplicate code from an example ([#​5072](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5072))
[`1248a19`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/1248a19) - feat(api): add `page.emulateTimezone(timezoneId)` ([#​4949](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/4949))
[`a86363f`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/a86363f) - feat(api): add `page.emulateMedia{Type,Features}` ([#​5012](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5012))
[`06dbb72`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/06dbb72) - chore: use map instead of plain object ([#​5068](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5068))
[`81d2600`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/81d2600) - feat(chromium): roll Chromium to r705776 ([#​5058](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5058))
[`3773229`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/3773229) - fix: avoid unnecessary zero-delays in input code ([#​4934](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/4934))
[`11ff374`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/11ff374) - chore: drop Node.js v6 support ([#​5045](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5045))

[`2506169`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/2506169) - docs(contributing): mention manual docs/api updates ([#​5023](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5023))
[`83c327a`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/83c327a) - docs(readme): correct Slack link

[`7dbb108`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/7dbb108) - docs(api): list Chromium version for Puppeteer v1.20.0 ([#​5015](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5015))

[`387a532`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/387a532) - chore: bump version to v1.20.0-post ([#​4939](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/4939))

### [`v1.20.0`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/releases/v1.20.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/compare/v1.19.0...v1.20.0)

#### Big changes

-   Chromium 78.0.3882.0 (r686378)
-   New APIs: [`element.evaluate`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#elementhandleevaluatepagefunction-args), [`element.evaluateHandle`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#elementhandleevaluatehandlepagefunction-args), [`element.select`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#elementhandleselectvalues), [`jsHandle.evaluate`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#jshandleevaluatepagefunction-args), [`jsHandle.evaluateHandle`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#jshandleevaluatehandlepagefunction-args)

#### API changes

##### Added

-   [`element.evaluate`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#elementhandleevaluatepagefunction-args) ([#​4892](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/pull/4892))
-   [`element.evaluateHandle`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#elementhandleevaluatehandlepagefunction-args) ([#​4892](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/pull/4892))
-   [`element.select`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#elementhandleselectvalues) ([#​4892](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/pull/4892))
-   [`jsHandle.evaluate`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#jshandleevaluatepagefunction-args) ([#​4892](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/pull/4892))
-   [`jsHandle.evaluateHandle`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#jshandleevaluatehandlepagefunction-args) ([#​4892](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/pull/4892))

#### Big Changes

-   Chromium 77.0.3844.0 (r674921)
-   New [File Chooser API](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.19.0/docs/api.md#class-filechooser) to handle file chooser dialogs.

#### API changes

##### Added

-   [`class: FileChooser`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.19.0/docs/api.md#class-filechooser) ([`ea28ccc`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/ea28cccfe021a22d1772ee4abfdf67d646aa6c17))
-   [`page.waitForFileChooser()`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.19.0/docs/api.md#pagewaitforfilechooseroptions) ([`ea28ccc`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/ea28cccfe021a22d1772ee4abfdf67d646aa6c17))

#### Bug Fixes

[#​2946](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/2946) - Handling File Input Dialogs
[#​4300](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/4300) - `backgroundpage.on('console')` not working
[#​4374](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/4374) - puppeteer.launch({ pipe: true }) may crash due to unhandled stream errors

Issues.Title: Asset hashing is not handled correctly in Universal
Issues.Body:
# Bug Report

#### What is the expected behavior?
When using output-hashing universal gets the information of the assets and can use those from the client to prevent loading the same asset twice.

#### What is the current behavior?
When using output-hashing it tries to access the image from the served apps folder without hashes. Therefore, it can't load the image when serving the server version. Only when the client app takes over, the images are rendered.

#### What modules are related to this issue?
```
- [x] common
- [x] express-engine
```


#### Minimal reproduction with instructions:
https://github.com/drdreo/ng-universal-hashing-demo

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
This might has to do something with the universal server setup which could be more detailed for such use-cases where you have a folder structure like.
```
dist
    -app
          -en
               -assets
          -fr
               -assets
    -server
```

#### Environment:
**@nguniversal versions**
 "@nguniversal/common": "^8.1.1",
    "@nguniversal/express-engine": "^8.1.1",
    "@nguniversal/module-map-ngfactory-loader": "^8.1.1",
```
Package                                    Version
--------------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect                  0.803.14
@angular-devkit/build-angular              0.803.14
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer            0.803.14
@angular-devkit/build-webpack              0.803.14
@angular-devkit/core                       8.3.14
@angular-devkit/schematics                 8.3.14
@angular/cli                               8.3.14
@ngtools/webpack                           8.3.14
@nguniversal/common                        8.1.1
@nguniversal/express-engine                8.1.1
@nguniversal/module-map-ngfactory-loader   8.1.1
@schematics/angular                        8.3.14
@schematics/update                         0.803.14
rxjs                                       6.5.3
typescript                                 3.5.3
webpack                                    4.39.2
```


#### Is there anything else we should know?

It only affects assets via css like: fonts or background images etc.

I have 3 locale apps with different output hashing settings for testing purpose:
- fr : "outputHashing": "all"
- en: "outputHashing": "bundles"
- it: "outputHashing": "none"

en & it apps can handle the background-image because the server app requests the image without a hash. But the fr version can not render the image and requests the image twice. One not hashed & one hashed as seen in the video. The sun.jpg should be the background.
![video](https://i.imgur.com/qcffB2q.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Asset hashing is not handled correctly in Universal" (#15953)

Issues.Title: docs: add package ID prefix to h3's ids
Issues.Body:
This helps avoid collisions in the table of content's sections like
"Directives" and "Services", since now we may show more than one
package entry point in docs (e.g. button and button-testing).

Note that we chose not to add the prefix to individual
class/constant/interface/etc names because it muddles the URL and
is unlikely that we collide on these values.

e.g
```html
<h3 id="material-button-directives" class="docs-header-link docs-api-h3">
```

```html
<h3 id="material-button-testing-interfaces" class="docs-header-link docs-api-h3">
```

Fixes #17526
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "docs: add package ID prefix to h3's ids" (#17527)

Issues.Title: Docs content needs to prefix HTML ids with the package name
Issues.Body:
The docs site now includes API docs for multiple entry points, which means our Table of Contents will need to point to more specific IDs than just "services" and "classes".

A change needs to be made to `entry-point.template.html` so that the `id=...` is prefixed so you have something like `material-button-classes` and `material-button-testing-classes`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Docs content needs to prefix HTML ids with the package name" (#17526)

Issues.Title: Mat-select disabled reactivity bug
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-3wepre

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Click "Select form 0"
2.  Click "Delete form 0"
3.  Click "Select form 1"
 
#### Expected Behavior

The "Object Type" field should not be disabled.

#### Actual Behavior

The UI for the "Object Type" field on form 1 is disabled even though the form's disabled property says otherwise. The weird thing is that the "First Name" field is not disabled which leads me to believe it is a bug with the mat-select specifically.

#### Environment

- Angular: 5.2.4
- CDK/Material :5.2.4
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat-select disabled reactivity bug" (#17531)

Issues.Title: Clearer documentation on TrackBy with respect to index
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

I had an issue adding/ deleting rows to/from Angular material table because the behavior of index isn't clear at all from the documentation.  On first glance, using the let i= index construct seems to suggest that all the work is done for you when in fact you need to specify a trackBy function to keep index synchronised when adding/removing rows from the datasource.  

In my case, I'm using Angular templated forms so I have to create a unique name for each input on every row which I do using the index and I'm sure this can't be an uncommon scenario so it would be good if this was made a bit clearer somewhere.

**Affected documentation page:** [https://material.angular.io/components/table/api](url)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Clearer documentation on TrackBy with respect to index" (#17525)

Issues.Title: feat: add coercion for string arrays
Issues.Body:
Adds a utility function to coerce string arrays. This has been very useful for CSS class lists or defining columns for a CDK table.

Handling of `null` and `undefined` (and objects) may be up for discussion. Currently they are mapped via [string interpolation](https://github.com/JanMalch/components/blob/feat/coerce-string-array/src/cdk/coercion/string-array.ts#L15) and [not filtered](https://github.com/JanMalch/components/blob/feat/coerce-string-array/src/cdk/coercion/string-array.spec.ts#L10).

(If this is not just a "small" feature, I'm happy to open up a new issue.)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat: add coercion for string arrays" (#17523)

Issues.Title: refactor(overlay): remove deprecated connected position strategy
Issues.Body:
The `ConnectedPositionStrategy` has been deprecated since at least 7.0.0 and is just a wrapper around `FlexibleConnectedPositionStrategy`. These changes remove it since it still adds a fair bit of code that has to be maintained.

BREAKING CHANGES:
* `ConnectedPositionStrategy` has been removed. Use `FlexibleConnectedPositionStrategy` instead.
* `OverlayPositionBuilder.connectedTo` has been removed. Use `OverlayPositionBuilder.flexibleConnectedTo` instead.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(overlay): remove deprecated connected position strategy" (#17519)

Issues.Title: auto-size-virtual-scroll: implement scrollToIndex and animation firing when near offset 0px
Issues.Body:
I'm trying to scroll to top after each route change where this experimental auto-size-virtual-scroll is used.

scrollToIndex() is not implemented
https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/cdk-experimental/scrolling/auto-size-virtual-scroll.ts#L166

and I don't know how to do it manually.

I'm hoping the assignee mmalerba can take a look at it, or maybe someone could answer how to force a reset to index 0 / scroll to top every time it's used on a new navigation target.

I have also noticed that before scrolling manually to top some kind of animation is ran which makes the whole thing look buggy.

You can see what I mean on https://m.shekortet.com/ (enable adblock)

Pick one of the menu items on the top and scroll for a while,
then click on one of the other items under tags.
You'll see a white page, but in reality it retains the scroll position of the previous component, which is not desired and should not happen.

Also try scrolling down a bit and back up to 0, you'll see some kind of animation firing that shouldn't be there.

Issues.Title: build: no longer depend on gulp for lint tasks
Issues.Body:
* Fixes the `prefer-literal` lint rule not actually running because it wasn't loaded in the tslint.json.
* Converts the CODEOWNERS linting task into a regular Node script that doesn't depend on Gulp.
* Turns the `stylelint` and `tslint` tasks into npm scripts.
* Runs the new npm scripts directly rather than through Gulp on the CI.

Issues.Title: Angular Material: Audio player component
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

There should be support for an Angular Material audio player component which would ideally be a wrapper over the native `<audio>` element in HTML.

The component should also expose outputs when the audio's playback state is toggled or when a new audio URL is set.

The component should ideally be easy for developers to set up the player.

There should also be support for playlists which most music applications implement.

(P.S. I was inspired by this library created by @vmudigal: https://github.com/vmudigal/ngx-audio-player. However, I would like to see this integrated into the main set of components available.)

#### Use Case

This feature would allow users to easily include this audio player in their app without having to create a custom player or use external 3rd-party components.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Material: Audio player component" (#17513)

Issues.Title: Dragging and dropping between two material tables
Issues.Body:
Got to the end of the internet and could not find a single example of Drag and drop between two Material tables. Found plenty examples of DIV dragging and List dragging but no one seems to have snippets for two tables dragging.
Been at it for a little while and can't get the destination table to accept the dropped row.
Code:  https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-agf3kv-qhsmgp?file=app%2Fcdk-drag-drop-disabled-sorting-example.ts

I would imagine I am doing something wrong but everything seems fine to me.
If nothing else, would appreciate the docs to include sample of table <> table drag and dropped.

Any ideas what's going on?

Thanks

Sean.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Dragging and dropping between two material tables" (#17509)

Issues.Title: Incorrect work of drag-and-drop with ng-container in ivy
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction repo for reproducing: https://github.com/nmatushevskiy/ivy-ng-container-bug-repro/ Steps to reproduce: 1. npm i 2. ng serve 3. Try dragging any item #### Expected Behavior Items being dragged correctly with using ng-container https://stackblitz.com/github/nmatushevskiy/ivy-ng-container-bug-repro (example without ivy) Code example: ```
{{item}}
``` #### Actual Behavior Dragging works incorrectly with using ng-container and ivy. With this code: ```
{{item}}
``` Have the following behavior: ![–°–Ω–∏–º–æ–∫ —ç–∫—Ä–∞–Ω–∞ 2019-10-25 –≤ 17 49 51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67580994-e8b27f80-f74f-11e9-9c1e-08692577b30b.png) And this, if I try to drag a few items: ![–°–Ω–∏–º–æ–∫ —ç–∫—Ä–∞–Ω–∞ 2019-10-25 –≤ 17 49 40](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67581009-ed773380-f74f-11e9-9b8e-f941369a2008.png) #### Environment - Angular: 9.0.0-next.13 - CDK/Material: 8.2.3 / 9.0.0-next.0 (I tried both) - Browser(s): Chrome v. 78.0.3904.70 - Operating System: macOS #### Workaround drag and drop works correct without ng-container. For example: ```
{{item}}
``` #### Comment By debugging established: in `drop-list.ts` (https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/cdk/drag-drop/directives/drop-list.ts) in `ngAfterContentInit` method there are no items: ![–°–Ω–∏–º–æ–∫ —ç–∫—Ä–∞–Ω–∞ 2019-10-25 –≤ 18 32 07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67584542-92950a80-f756-11e9-9f41-0207eeffb72a.png) While without ivy all items received: ![–°–Ω–∏–º–æ–∫ —ç–∫—Ä–∞–Ω–∞ 2019-10-25 –≤ 18 35 36](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67584683-d6880f80-f756-11e9-9f0c-79e61b04f344.png) Also, with ivy doesn't work output `cdkDropListDropped`. By comparing code with and without ivy it was found out: in `drag-ref.ts` (https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/cdk/drag-drop/drag-ref.ts) in method `_endDragSequence`, `this._dragDropRegistry.isDragging` returns false, so the code below is not being executed. Thats why the output is not called. ![–°–Ω–∏–º–æ–∫ —ç–∫—Ä–∞–Ω–∞ 2019-10-25 –≤ 18 48 33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67585959-3bdd0000-f759-11e9-9a6e-187bb6898889.png) While without ivy `this._dragDropRegistry.isDragging` returns true and output called correctly ![–°–Ω–∏–º–æ–∫ —ç–∫—Ä–∞–Ω–∞ 2019-10-25 –≤ 18 58 54](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67586131-8e1e2100-f759-11e9-9d6f-79f301c2e47c.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Incorrect work of drag-and-drop with ng-container in ivy" (#17505)

Issues.Title: MatTabGroup - Add ability to intercept tab changes
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

As a developer, I would like a way to intercept tab changes in mat-tab-group and prevent the change under certain conditions

#### Use Case

This feature would enable us to stop tab changes if a form in the tab is dirty or invalid, show a pop-up, and prevent the tab change based on the user decision.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatTabGroup - Add ability to intercept tab changes" (#17506)

Issues.Title: disabled-sorting doesn't work after some iterations
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
0. go to https://material.angular.io/cdk/drag-drop/overview#disabled-sorting
1. put carrot in target list
2. put apple in target list
3. put carrot back in source list
 
#### Expected Behavior

Preserving the dragged item's initial position in the source list, if the user decides to return the item

#### Actual Behavior

Carrot goes below tomato after being put back in source list 

#### Environment

- Opera browser on windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "disabled-sorting doesn't work after some iterations" (#17504)
